summary: A "freeze-dried product" refers to foodstuffs that have undergone a specific preservation process, wherein moisture is removed through sublimation, resulting in a lightweight and shelf-stable item. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, such products must comply with stringent food safety standards, including labeling requirements and nutritional information as outlined in Regulation (EU) No 1169/2011. Additionally, the production and marketing of freeze-dried products are subject to the General Food Law (Regulation (EC) No 178/2002), ensuring consumer protection and traceability. These regulations aim to guarantee that freeze-dried products are safe for consumption and meet quality standards across the EU market.
